Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of a lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres above two white bands; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved with painted inscription.
Curator's comments: The number '24' is written in pencil on the sherd's exterior. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds above two white bands on the interior (Williams 1983, 169). Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim, and they have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 167, no. 65)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 720, no. 787)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1814) (phase 2)
